etymologies: late 18th century: from Latin vaccinus, from vacca ‘cow’ (because of the early use of the cowpox virus against smallpox)

definitions: a substance used to stimulate the production of antibodies and provide immunity against one or several diseases, prepared from the causative agent of a disease, its products, or a synthetic substitute, treated to act as an antigen without inducing the disease

examples.text: there is no vaccine against the virus

shortDefinitions: substance used to stimulate production of antibodies and provide immunity against diseases

definitions: a program designed to detect computer viruses and inactivate them.
shortDefinitions: program designed to detect computer viruses and inactivate them
